org.opentcs.algorithms

Interface DeadlockPredictor


  • public interface DeadlockPredictor
    A DeadlockPredictor manages resources used by vehicles, preventing deadlocks. A system simulation state is updated according to the real world state. Resource requests, allocations and deallocations are performed to achieve deadlock free simulation results.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configureSystemData(ResourceUser resourceUser, java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>> alloc, java.util.List<java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>>> remainingClaim)
      Updates the simulation state to the real system state.
      boolean isAllocationAdmissible(ResourceUser resourceUser, java.util.Set<TCSResource> resSet)
      Checks if the resulting system state is safe if the given set of resources would be allocated by the given resource user.

      Sets a vehicle's route, represented by a sequence of resource sets corresponding to one Step each.

    • Method Detail

      • setRoute

        void setRoute(ResourceUser resourceUser,
              java.util.List<java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>>> resourcesSequence)
        Sets a vehicle's route, represented by a sequence of resource sets corresponding to one Step each. Such a sequence is also called total claim. Total claim is equivalent to the route computed by Dijkstra's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser the resource sequence is assigned to.
        resourcesSequence - The resource sequence, i.e. total claim.

      • configureSystemData

        void configureSystemData(ResourceUser resourceUser,
                         java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>> alloc,
                         java.util.List<java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>>> remainingClaim)
        Updates the simulation state to the real system state. If any simulation results have already been computed, the simulation state corresponding to the real state will be looked up in the system state tree. If no simulation results are available, the new root allocation state will be generated according to the new input data and simulation will be started. Call this method when
        • simulation is started for the first time
        • the real system state has been changed, so the changes influence the simulation results, i.e. the simulation should be restarted. (Vehicle failure, unexpected allocation state etc. require the simulation state to be adapted to the new real allocation state.)
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The resource user
        alloc - The current allocation.
        remainingClaim - The remaining claim of a given resource user.

      • isAllocationAdmissible

        boolean isAllocationAdmissible(ResourceUser resourceUser,
                               java.util.Set<TCSResource> resSet)
        Checks if the resulting system state is safe if the given set of resources would be allocated by the given resource user.
        Parameters:
        resourceUser - The ResourceUser requesting resources set.
        resSet - The requested resource set.
        Returns:
        true if no deadlock is predicted for the given resource allocation.
